ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This spanish course integrates gramatical, reading and auditory language skills through classroom discussions, presentations and essays that focus on sociopolitical and cultural issues facing Latin America. Topics range from discussing artistic representations of witches, films of indigenous communities and presentations on post-truth and fake news.
I learned a lot about organizing my thoughts in Spanish, reading and responding to various forms of media in Spanish, and speaking in the language with my classmates.

I learned more about Latin American and indigenous culture and the impacts of colonialism and materialism. I also learned a lot about topics related to things like feminism and immigration from a different viewpoint.
i learned how to develop my spanish speaking skills and learn about latin american culture. i was especially interested in indigenous cosmovisin.
My speaking improved greatly.
I learned about important themes such as  indigenismo and fake news. I also improved my oral and written Spanish skills.
Deeper understanding of the Spanish language and Latin American cultures, especially with regard to indigenous peoples
I improved my Spanish skills and learned a lot of interesting information about the Spanish culture.
I developed verbal, reading, and writing skills in the Spanish language, as well as greater knowledge of Latin American culture.
Spanish conversation and writing and reading

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The content of the course is excellent.

Profesora is incredible. She is an amazing teacher, and she wants all of her students to succeed. The classroom environment is incredibly welcoming for students with all backgrounds in Spanish, and feels incredibly comfortable and inclusive. Students do not feel afraid trying to speak Spanish. Profesora is incredibly nice and supportive to all students.

The course is very immersive in culture and language and is very engaging, but I had trouble keeping up with the pace of it as well as the size of the class. It would be nice to spend more time in discussion and small group discussion and cover less topics. The group projects were also a mess because we really struggled with time management and proper distribution of work.
i think the projects are very interesting but the activities in class are not very engaging. it is easy to space out.
I enjoyed how interactive class was. We did a different activity every day so I was always engaged.
It was a very positive environment to practice Spanish!

The course allows students to engage with a variety of resources (i.e. books, documentaries, plays) in order to explore the vibrance of Latin American culture and the Spanish language. I think the course syllabus could be reformed so that things are less chaotic towards the end of the course and there are less projects assigned so close to one another.
Great course! Taught well.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this course to any student that is excited to continue pursuing linguistic proficiency in Spanish and who is also interested in the issues facing Central and South American marginalized communities.

I would highly highly highly recommend this class to another student. The class content and work is paced extremely comfortably to give students time to absorb material and apply their knowledge in reflection. The assignments are not too taxing or difficult, and I think they assess understanding of the content well. Profesora has an incredibly welcoming environment and students feel very comfortable participating.
yes, it was a good way to learn more of the Spanish language and culture of Spanish speaking countries
I would recommend this class if you want to learn more about Spanish and indigenous culture.
yes especially with Ximena!
Yes absolutely, especially with Ximena. She is amazing!!
Yes!
Yes, it taught some very cool concepts and ideas that I didnt think I would get exposed to at L4.
Yes! It was great and very helpful

Yes, I would recommend this course to other students looking to fulfill their language requirements. The course was manageable and enjoyable. I learned not only about the Spanish language, but about important social and political issues affecting our world today, specifically Latin American countries.
Yes! Ximena is amazing, and the course is solid. Take it if you are at all interested in Spanish.
